page.title: 18The Court Leet 'B'.
page.content: This second court,the Area Court,met once a fortnight with the Mayor as a Chairman.Its most important task was to try trespassers,debtors,slanderers etc.and settle any arguement that arose.The fines given to wrong-doers went into the pocket of the Lord. As in olden times,the Lady Marcher of Cemais still appoints her Mayor my receiving three nominations from her Burgesses and making her own selection,nearly everything else has changed.Burgesses are still appointed,the Court Leet still meets and acts in the interest of the Lady Marcher and the town. Few such Courts remain by today and Newport is virtually unique in having its Mayor 'made' in early November(same date as London's Lord Mayor).Virtually all other Mayors are now Town Mayors 'made'in May each year
